Enterprise Architect

Company Name Marshall McAdam Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 12 hours ago Number of views 12 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Enterprise Architect


New role, reporting to CIO


ASX listed, expanding through acquisition


The role

As Enterprise Architect, you will play a lead role in shaping the technology strategy for this expanding organisation, where maximising success following recent acquisition is paramount. This Enterprise Architect will have a strong influence on the future technology landscape.


This role will include;

  • Liaising with the business leaders and executives to identify requirements.
  • Raising the profile of the value that technology solutions can provide for the business.
  • Defining the end to end IT Strategy to enable the company's strategic business goals.
  • Determining fit for purpose IS solutions across infrastructure, applications and data.
  • Leading the rationalisation of multiple ERP/CRM solutions
  • Establishing ongoing technology governance, defining policies and principles


This Enterprise Architecture role is a high-profile role for the organisation, essential to success is your ability to define pragmatic solutions and then articulate those in both business and technology terms. You will engage with the CEO, Head of business transformation and CIO.


There will also be leadership responsibilities aligned with this role, managing the Data & Analytics lead, shaping the strategy for Data Reporting and Analytics that will support business decision making.


The organisation


This national organisation is and established ASX listed services organisation. With a focus on the environment and sustainability there is a strong passion for continuous improvement. Business disciplines include engineering, logistics, distribution, science and its customer base ranges from general consumers to local communities and heavy-duty industry.


This is also a commercially focused organisation, with significant growth across multiple operating divisions it has a reputation for competitive excellence.


The technology environment


With a user base of over 5000 across Australia, the current technology landscape includes multiple ERP solutions, over 150 applications, SaaS, On-premise and hybrid cloud solutions and an appetite for expansion of digital solutions.


To apply please forward your resume or call Christine Hubble on 03 8399 9311 for a confidential discussion.

Desired Skills and Experience

Enterprise Architect, New role, expanding organisation, working with the business and technology to shape solutions.

[

Utilities Manager

Company Name Carlton & United Breweries Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 12 hours ago Number of views 11 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About CUB

Carlton & United Breweries (CUB) is one of Australia’s most iconic companies. We locally brew some of Australia's most famous beers including Victoria Bitter, Carlton Draught, Pure Blonde, Great Northern, Matilda Bay and ciders including Strongbow, Mercury and Bulmers, as well as distribute some of the world’s leading international brands including Corona, Stella Artois and Budweiser.

Joining CUB, you are opening up a world of career possibilities. We are a part of AB InBev, the largest and only truly global brewer selling over 400 brands across 100 markets and employing 200,000 people. Our Dream is to bring people together for a better world. We are committed to driving growth that leads to better living for more people in more places and focussed on bringing people and cultures together through our brands and experiences.

The Role

Reporting to the Engineering Manager, the Utilities Manager will manage the execution of engineering and maintenance systems and work practices within the utilities plant production facility. The utilities Manger will also manage a strategic plan to optimise the capability and efficiency of Abbotsford brewery utilities efficiency.

Key accountabilities for this role include
  • Manage the production and distribution of Steam, Water, Refrigeration, Electricity, Effluent and Carbon Dioxide for the entire brewery.
  • Lead and drive the efficiency and usage reduction program for utilities across site in order to ensure that budget targets are met, through the implementation of ABInbev best practices.
  • Ensure efficient execution of maintenance strategy for Utilities plant, optimised for plant reliability and cost.
  • Lead, own and manage Utilities plant asset replacement strategy.
  • Develop and manage outsourced supplier service contracts
  • Ensure employees perform the requirements of their role and develop them to be effective contributors through People Way Processes.
  • Maintain a safe, healthy and risk free working environment
  • Analyse, report on and control cost variances and cost reduction opportunities.
  • Lead and manage problem solving processes in Utilities team.
  • Lead and manage process change management initiatives in Utilities team and across the Abbotsford plant.
  • Who you are

    The ideal candidate for this role will
  • Engineering qualifications
  • Have strong knowledge utilities processes and technologies, ideally from within a manufacturing environment
  • Sound technical competence in Reliability Engineering
  • Knowledge of Refrigeration, Steam Systems and Services Supply
  • Possess proven leadership skills
  • Be computer literate – including the use of a CMMS
  • Have proven analytical problem solving skills
  • Possess the ability to influence key stakeholders across sound maintenance practices
  • Understand asset management strategies and initiatives


What We Offer

Learn on the job. Jump in at the deep-end. Dream big!

At CUB, our greatest strength is our people. We recruit people who can be better than ourselves and retain people by allowing them to grow at their own pace, providing training opportunities and offering a safe environment where they will be rewarded for their contributions. To learn more, visit AB InBev - Our 10 principles.

Be part of the world’s largest consumer company where opportunity awaits, and apply now!

Associate

  • Food & Beverages

Company Name Optus Company Location Burwood, AU

New Posted Date Posted 3 hours ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

Here at Optus Retail, we’re excited about the potential for new ideas and new approaches to improve people’s lives and we’re looking for a Retail Consultant who feels the same.

The role

We’re offering you the opportunity to build on your knowledge and expertise in sales, guided by a clear career pathway and training. You’ll be empowered to take your experience to the next level by transforming customer curiosity into partnership and using your passion for technology to create innovative and customised solutions.

Being a Retail Consultant is more than just a job. You’ll love to chat and have a genuine interest in people and their story, enabling you to identify solutions that are unique to each customer. You’re a point of contact and role model for the team, leading by example with strong results against established targets and a desire to expand on your responsibilities with an aim to achieve your career aspirations. Encouraged to look at the bigger picture, you’ll include our customers in our journey moving beyond telco, into a total home and business solution retailer.

The perks
We offer personal development, formal training, individual commissions and discounts on essential products and services. This is an exciting time to be at Optus. As we move beyond the role of a traditional telco, we have new challenges and opportunities for those looking to join in, take them on and grow with us.

About You

We’re looking for people who are passionate, knowledgeable and ready to take the next step in their retail career. Successful people in our stores come from diverse backgrounds and the skills we look for are:
  • Communication – You are renowned as a great communicator
  • People Focus – You’re a listener and relationship builder who provides incredible customer experiences
  • Sales – Your communication skills have always made you stand out as a top performer and used to working towards KPIs
  • Team work – You recognise the importance of building and contributing to workplace culture
  • Drive, ambition and desire for career progression and ability to support the team in achieving success
  • Curiosity – You like to keep up to date with the latest and greatest technology


About Us

At Optus, we don’t sit back and let the future happen to us – we’re out there making it. By expanding into new technology and relentlessly improving every day, we’re creating a better tomorrow for all Australians. Apply now to join us.

Optus believes in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers.

Heads Up!
Due to the fast paced nature of our business, vacancy close dates may change, so make sure you apply today!

839500816:
[

Trainer - Information Communication Systems (ICT) - Microsoft Specialist

Company Name Box Hill Institute Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 20 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Located at Defence Force base (Simpson Barracks) in Yallambie, VIC 3085
  • Fixed-Term, Full Time contract until December 2019
  • Attractive salary plus compulsory superannuation contribution


About The Role

The Teacher - Information Communications Systems provides high quality and innovative course materials and excellent teaching delivery to Defence Force School of Signals (DFSS) students.

The Box Hill Institute Command Support Training (CST) team provides training and assessment services designed to meet the workforce development needs of the Defence Force School of Signals (DFSS). This is achieved through a partnership with the Australian Defence Forces, ensuring flexible training and assessment solutions are customised, updated and refined to meet the changing expectations of our students, and their employers.

Your Skills And Experience

We are seeking a tertiary qualified person with demonstrated knowledge and experience at a senior level in Information Communication Systems disciplines. Demonstrated knowledge and/or experience in Microsoft Server 2012R2 Administration/Training Delivery (An MCP in MS Server 2008 and above is required) with MCSA/MCSE/MCT being highly desirable.

Training needs to meet requirements of the Defence Forces, and as such training modes may vary, and may include interstate delivery, delivery in blocks of more than 21 hours teaching a week, and training delivery outside the span of hours.

If you have excellent communication skills and the ability to motivate and guide students to optimise their learning outcomes, this may be the role for you! The role will be located at a Defence Force base (Simpson Barracks) in the suburb of Yallambie. A truly unique working environment, and rewarding role where your students will translate their learnings to serve Australia.

Applicants must be able to prove they hold Australian Citizenship, as this is a prerequisite to obtaining NV1 level Defence Security. You will also need to provide a current National Police Check, a Working with Children Check, and certified copies of your qualifications.

Like to know more? If you have questions about this role, please contact Andrew Rees at a.rees@boxhill.edu.au or by phone on 9286 9232.

Applications close: 9am, Wednesday 19 September 2018

The Box Hill Institute Group reserves the right to withdraw an advertised position at any stage.

#LI

Coordinator Financial Accounting

Company Name Knox City Council Company Location Knox, AU

New Posted Date Posted 19 hours ago Number of views 25 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Annual remuneration package circa $115,000
  • Monthly RDO

Knox City Council is positioned in Melbourne’s picturesque eastern suburbs—reaching to the foothills of the Dandenong Ranges. Our staff of more than 1000 serves a diverse and vibrant population. Connected within 25 minutes of the city by the EastLink motorway, we attract professionals with a passionate commitment to our community and their vocation within an innovative culture of excellence.

If you are seeking to create a collaborative and innovative environment which encourages community and employee engagement, strives to be the best in its field, is passionate about its services, values and future, then you are looking in the right place!

This position contributes to the provision of high quality financial services to the City of Knox. The Coordinator Financial Accounting oversees all aspects of the day-to-day financial services functions including Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable, coordinates the preparation of the Annual Financial Report, manages the treasury function and the preparation of statutory returns including Business Activity Statements, Taxable Payments Annual Report and the Fringe Benefits Tax return, maintains the integrity of the general ledger and monitors and enhances internal controls.

Key Responsibilities
  • Effectively guide, support, co-ordinate and supervise the team’s employees in a manner that ensures the unit’s objectives are achieved.
  • Co-ordinate the preparation of Council's Annual Financial Report in a timely and effective manner.
  • Co-ordinate the Accounts Payable and Receivable functions.
  • Oversee the treasury function including cash flow reporting.
  • Maintain the integrity of the general ledger.
  • Co-ordinate the preparation of statutory returns including FBT, GST and grant acquittal reports.
  • Drive continued improvement and innovation in financial processes.


Applicants Must Have
  • Strong interpersonal skills.
    Demonstrated experience in a similar role in a dynamic organisation.
  • Commitment to service excellence and innovation.
  • Have, or be eligible for, CA/CPA Qualification.
  • Excellent attention to detail skills.

Application must include a cover letter, resume and responses addressing the selection criteria outlined within the Position Description.

Applications Close 11:45pm: 13 September 2018

Knox Council is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion. We are committed to a positive, barrier-free recruitment process. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application.

Group Manager - Risk & Internal Assurance

Company Name Sharp & Carter Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 50 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About The Company

With a growing global presence, our client is Australia’s largest ASX listed horticultural organisation and a major supplier of produce to retailers in the country. Its name has been synonymous with fresh fruit and vegetables for more than 120 years and its growth has been achieved through a strong consumer focus. Working together to serve its customers, the organisation is steadily growing on the back of a clear strategic plan and a culture that is underpinned by values that include Passion, Determination, Respect, Sincerity and Accountability. This is an exciting time for the business as it looks for key people who are ready to make a difference and help shape the horticultural landscape both locally and abroad.

About The Role

Our client has undergone significant transformational change over its recent history, having transformed from a privately held company to a large publicly listed enterprise. The business has grown substantially during that time and is now at the stage in its organisational life cycle where a dedicated internal risk and assurance function is required.

Reporting to the CFO with functional reporting to the Audit and Risk Committee, this newly created role will facilitate the development, implementation and continuous improvement of the organisation's risk management framework and internal assurance program.

This role is expected to be hands on, including fieldwork to undertake internal assurance reviews, and will work closely with senior management to enhance risk management activities, strategies and actions across the organisation’s business units. Future team capability will be developed as the organisation and risk and internal assurance function continues to mature.

The Ideal Candidate
CA or CPA qualified and ideally commencing in a Big 4 environment, the GM of Risk & Internal Audit will have a minimum of 10 years’ experience as a leader and influencer across the organisation in a similar role and large sized blue-chip organisation. You will have extensive experience in establishing a Risk & Internal Audit function. The successful candidate must be an aspiring leader with a desire to succeed and willingness to partner with senior stakeholders both internally and externally. With a solutions focus and a strategic mindset, you will be able to strive to deliver a global risk, assurance and compliance framework that is best practice. This role requires domestic and international travel half of the time.
